Package data.api

Interface IClock

All Known Implementing Classes:
Clock
public interface IClock
Represents a measurement in time, displayed in seconds, minutes, and hours. This is created because we have no need of the added complexities with the build in java time classes.
Since:
2.0.0

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    IClock
    abs()
    Calls the Math.abs(int) method on the time, essentially making it positive if it was negative

  • Method Details

    • getTime

      int getTime()
      Returns the current time represented in the Clock
      Returns:
      The current time, in seconds

    • setTime

      void setTime(int time)
      Sets the represented time in the clock
      Parameters:
      time - The new time to represent, in seconds.

    • getAdd

      IClock getAdd(IClock other)
      Adds another clock's time to this clock's value, but returns a new instance without modifying any clock's time value
      Parameters:
      other - The other clock to add to this clock
      Returns:
      A new IClock instance with a value equal to this clock's value plus the provided clock's value

    • getAdd

      IClock getAdd(int time)
      Adds time to this clock's value, but returns a new instance without modifying any clock's time value
      Parameters:
      time - The number of seconds to add to this clock's value
      Returns:
      A new IClock instance with a value equal to this clock's value plus the provided time in seconds

    • getSubtract

      IClock getSubtract(IClock other)
      Subtracts another clock's value from this clock's value, but returns a new instance without modifying either clock's value
      Parameters:
      other - The other clock to remove from this clock
      Returns:
      A new IClock instance with a value equal to this clock's value minus the provided clock's value

    • getSubtract

      IClock getSubtract(int time)
      Subtracts time to this clock's value, but returns a new instance without modifying any clock's time value
      Parameters:
      time - The number of seconds to subtract from this clock's value
      Returns:
      A new IClock instance with a value equal to this clock's value minus the provided time

    • getAbs

      IClock getAbs()
      Gets the absolute value of this clock, but returns a new instance without modifying this clock's time
      Returns:
      A new IClock instance with a value equal to the absolute value of this clock's time

    • getElapsed

      IClock getElapsed(IClock other)
      Returns the absolute difference between this clock's time and another clock's time.
      Parameters:
      other - The other clock to measure the distance between
      Returns:
      A new IClock instance with a value equal to the absolute difference between this clock and the provided clock

    • add

      IClock add(IClock other)
      Adds another clock's value to this value
      Parameters:
      other - The other clock to add to this value
      Returns:
      A reference to this IClock instance

    • add

      IClock add(int time)
      Adds time to this clock's value
      Parameters:
      time - The time, in seconds, to add to this clock
      Returns:
      A reference to this IClock instance

    • subtract

      IClock subtract(IClock other)
      Subtracts another clock's value from this value
      Parameters:
      other - The other clock to subtract this value by
      Returns:
      A reference to this IClock instance

    • subtract

      IClock subtract(int time)
      Subtracts time from this clock
      Parameters:
      time - The time, in seconds, to subtract this clock by
      Returns:
      A reference to this IClock instance

    • abs

      IClock abs()
      Calls the Math.abs(int) method on the time, essentially making it positive if it was negative
      Returns:
      A reference to this IClock instance

    • asString

      String asString()
      Compiles the time into a human-readable format
      Returns:
      The human-readable string representing this time
